item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Barely Move Ahead of Anticipated 25Bp Fed Rate Rise
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields were barely changed ahead of the Fed’s rate decision—likely a 25 basis point increase—later in the day.

item.title: Oil Adds to Sharp Losses on Growth Worries
item.description: Oil prices edged lower in Europe as continued worries about the health of U.S. banks have revived concerns about the economy.

item.title: How European Economies Are Finding New Ways to Pay for War on Their Doorstep
item.description: European governments are struggling to come up with ways to pay for a new era of higher costs, but many European populations don’t want to see their already relatively high tax rates pumped up further.

item.title: Base Metals Slip, Gold Rises Ahead of Fed Interest Rate Decision
item.description: Base metals were slightly lower in London trade, with gold up a touch, with analysts saying Jerome Powell’s comments will be crucial as to whether he signals if the Fed will tighten further to fight inflation, despite ongoing banking sector stresses.

item.title: Malaysia's Central Bank Hikes Benchmark Rate
item.description: Bank Negara Malaysia raised its benchmark interest rate for the first time so far this year, saying that the economy’s growth prospects look resilient.

item.title: Dollar Falls as Markets Await What Could Be Last US Rate Increase
item.description: The dollar was weaker in Europe, as investors await the latest Fed decision, with the focus on whether the central bank keeps the door open to another rate increase or indicates a pause in June, RBC said.

item.title: Haleon Key Earnings Margin Dips
item.description: Haleon posted inproved pretax profit for the first quarter, but said its adjusted operating profit margin fell to 23.1%, slightly below consensus forecasts.

item.title: Lloyds Backs Guidance as Profits Jump
item.description: Lloyds Banking maintained its full-year outlook after it posted above-forecast profits of £2.3 billion in the first quarter, despite customer deposits falling £2.2 billion.

item.title: BNP Paribas' 1Q Exceeds Expectations as Result Reflects Capital Gain
item.description: RBC Capital Markets said BNP Paribas revenues exceeded consensus by 3%, overcoming cost increases which were 1.5% higher than expected, adding that the 1Q print was a good result for the bank which also benefited from its diversification.

item.title: Stellantis Backs Targets After Sales Rise
item.description: Stellantis confirmed its full-year guidance after reporting a 14% rise in revenue in the first quarter on more shipments and higher net pricing.

item.title: UniCredit Upgrades Outlook After Strong First Quarter
item.description: UniCredit lifted its financial forecasts for 2023 after revenue and earnings rose above expectations in the first quarter, helped by growth of 44% in net interest income.

item.title: Deutsche Post Backs Outlook After First-Quarter Beat
item.description: Deutsche Post reiterated its 2023 guidance after earnings and revenue in the first quarter came in ahead of forecast.

item.title: Lufthansa Confident on Outlook Despite First-Quarter Miss
item.description: Lufthansa confirmed its capacity and earnings forecasts for the year, fuelled by an expected strong summer travel season, but reported below-consensus numbers in the first quarter.

item.title: BNP Paribas Boosted by Bank of the West Windfall
item.description: BNP Paribas posted above-forecast revenue and profit in the first quarter, helped by its U.S. sale, confirmed its targets for this year, and reiterated its 2025 objectives.

item.title: Texas Mass Shooting Suspect Arrested After Dayslong Manhunt
item.description: Francisco Oropesa had been on the lam since Friday night. His arrest brings an end to a sprawling manhunt that involved hundreds of law-enforcement officials going door to door.

item.title: Eighth-Graders Don't Know Much About History
item.description: Record low scores in U.S. history and civics mark a reversal of gains made since the 1990s, the National Assessment of Educational Progress indicated.

item.title: A retired businesswoman told a jury that Trump sexually assaulted her on an airplane decades ago, testifying in support of writer E. Jean Carroll, who has accused the former president of raping her.
item.description: A retired businesswoman told a jury that Trump sexually assaulted her on an airplane decades ago, testifying in support of writer E. Jean Carroll, who has accused the former president of raping her.

item.title: Home builders are enjoying stronger-than-expected business this spring, capitalizing on the recent fall in mortgage rates and a shortage of existing homes for sale.
item.description: Home builders are enjoying stronger-than-expected business this spring, capitalizing on the recent fall in mortgage rates and a shortage of existing homes for sale.

item.title: Pfizer's revenue and earnings fell by nearly a third on plummeting demand for the company's Covid-19 vaccine, but the results beat Wall Street expectations.
item.description: Pfizer’s revenue and earnings fell by nearly a third on plummeting demand for the company’s Covid-19 vaccine, but the results beat Wall Street expectations.

item.title: Starbucks said that higher prices and more-efficient operations helped drive up sales and profit, while business in its China market improved.
item.description: Starbucks said that higher prices and more-efficient operations helped drive up sales and profit, while business in its China market improved.
